page.title: 17Methodism in Endon (1).
page.content: This year,1985,the Methodists are celebrating 150 years of the Methodist Church in Endon.Methodism was brought to the village by a farming family from nearby Gratton.For some years they met together with other Methodists in their own homes.In 1835,a small chapel was built near to the well and it still survives today as a private dwelling.It was a time of Methodist expansion and soon it was necessary to have a larger building and so in 1875 the present church was built on the main road opposite the Fountain. Today it is a thriving community, having over a hundred members.Sunday worship is well attended,the Sunday School continues its work with the new generation of children and the Women's Fellowship is more popular than ever.
